title.value: Development of Error Passing Network for Optimizing the Prediction of VO 2 peak in Childhood Acute Leukemia Survivors
title.justification: The title of the paper is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the document and in the header on each page as 'Development of Error Passing Network for Optimizing the Prediction of VO 2 peak in Childhood Acute Leukemia Survivors'.
title.quote: Development of Error Passing Network for Optimizing the Prediction of VO 2 peak in Childhood Acute Leukemia Survivors

extractions.description: The paper introduces the Error Passing Network (EPN), a novel graph-based method that utilizes relationships between samples to improve predictions made by any machine learning model. The aim is to optimize the prediction of VO 2 peak in childhood acute leukemia survivors using this method in conjunction with baseline models. The study demonstrates significant improvement in prediction accuracy, emphasizing the potential of personalized and efficient monitoring in healthcare using the proposed model.

type.justification: The paper presents empirical evidence by testing the proposed Error Passing Network (EPN) on real datasets to evaluate its performance improvements in predicting VO 2 peak in childhood acute leukemia survivors.
type.quote: We tested our approach to estimate patients’ VO 2 peak, a reliable indicator of their cardiac health.

name.justification: The research combines machine learning with health data to predict VO 2 peak in childhood acute leukemia survivors, fitting the scope of Health Informatics.
name.quote: Development of Error Passing Network for Optimizing the Prediction of VO 2 peak in Childhood Acute Leukemia Survivors

name.justification: The proposed Error Passing Network is a novel graph-based method, indicating a strong focus on graph-based machine learning techniques.
name.quote: In this work, we propose the Error Passing Network (EPN), a graph-based method...

name.justification: The research involves creating prediction models for clinical outcomes (VO 2 peak) using health data.
name.quote: Our model leverages similarities among patients to propagate residuals from a machine learning model and subsequently adjust its predictions.

name.justification: The Error Passing Network (EPN) is the primary model introduced and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: In this work, we propose the Error Passing Network (EPN), a graph-based method...

is_contributed.justification: The EPN is introduced as a novel method in this paper, thus it is a contribution by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we propose the Error Passing Network (EPN), a graph-based method...

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and tested in experiments to evaluate its performance.
is_executed.quote: We tested our approach to estimate patients’ VO 2 peak, a reliable indicator of their cardiac health.

is_compared.justification: The performance of EPN was compared to other models such as linear regression and random forest in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We evaluated the EPN with predictions made by different machine learning models...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The attention mechanism from 'Attention is all you need' is a key aspect of the EPN model as discussed in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In this work, we propose a novel graph-based approach that leverages the power of attention (Vaswani et al., 2017)...

name.justification: XGBoost was one of the baseline models used in conjunction with EPN for prediction tasks.
name.quote: We evaluated the EPN with predictions made by different machine learning models frequently considered for regression tasks... and the XGBoost algorithm from xgboost library (Chen and Guestrin, 2016).

is_contributed.justification: XGBoost is a well-known model commonly used in machine learning tasks and was not developed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: and the XGBoost algorithm from xgboost library (Chen and Guestrin, 2016).

is_executed.justification: XGBoost was executed as one of the baseline models for comparison with the EPN model.
is_executed.quote: We evaluated the EPN with predictions made by different machine learning models frequently considered for regression tasks...

is_compared.justification: The model was benchmarked against the EPN and other baseline models.
is_compared.quote: We evaluated the EPN with predictions made by different machine learning models... including XGBoost.

referenced_paper_title.value: XGBoost: A Scalable Tree Boosting System
referenced_paper_title.justification: XGBoost was used as a reference model, and this is the known reference paper for it.
referenced_paper_title.quote: and the XGBoost algorithm from xgboost library (Chen and Guestrin, 2016).

name.justification: The PETALE dataset is the primary dataset used in the study for the analysis of childhood ALL survivors.
name.quote: The PETALE dataset (Marcoux et al., 2017) analysed during the current study is not publicly available for confidentiality purposes.

referenced_paper_title.value: The PETALE study: Late adverse effects and biomarkers in childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia survivors
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset information aligns with the study conducted in the referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The PETALE dataset (Marcoux et al., 2017) analysed during the current study is not publicly available for confidentiality purposes.

name.justification: Scikit-learn was used for implementing some of the baseline models.
name.quote: We evaluated the EPN with predictions made by different machine learning models... from scikit-learn library (Pedregosa et al., 2011).

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the foundational paper for the Scikit-learn library, which was used in this paper.

name.justification: Pytorch was used for implementing the EPN model in the experiments.
name.quote: We implemented the EPN using Pytorch (Paszke et al., 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the foundational paper for Pytorch, which was used to implement the EPN model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We implemented the EPN using Pytorch (Paszke et al., 2019).
